name: The Odyssey: Winds of Athena
description: As the Greek Goddess Athena, control the wind, seas, and air to guide the hero Odysseus home from the Trojan Wars. The incredibly realistic water current simulation will amaze and challenge you, as you use your powers to protect the Hero's fleet.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 98, XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10 Processor: 2 GHz dual core Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 128 MB, OpenGL compatible video card with latest drivers installed Storage: 250 MB available space

God Game : The Odyssey reminds me of playing in the creek when I was a kid. The graphics aren't great but they do the job. I found it amusing (in a good way).

Fun little puzzle game. You play god by controlling the oceans and wind and other things. Its really easy to grasp the concept but it can be really tough at some levels.   I have only played the first handful of levels at the time of this review, so keep that in mind: You are given a set amount of boats that you have to get from point A to point B, there are obstacles and some objectives. Say you have 20 boats, you can pass the level by getting 5 boats to the objective without being destroyed, or you can pass the level with EXPERT by getting 15 boats to the end.  Definitely a cool concept and I would recommend it as an interesting puzzle/RTS. Very different from anything I have ever played so thats a +1

this is a fun little game, that is easy to learn and hard to master! Learning to play was easy, and they added more and more obsticles, and the Levels got harder and harder each time.   the goal of the game is really simple, kind of a reverse tower defence. You try to get the Boats from point A to point B and everything in between is trying ot stop you :)

The game looks like it's from the 90's but it's a funny new puzzel game. You move the boats from point A to B using Wind and the Current of the Water to move them along. The Mechanics and physics of the game is very well done. You'll have reef/sandbar in the way that you'll need to move around. So controlling a few ships at a time helps.   Now I can see how the early settlers felt like in the Ocean. Like the God's were F*cking with them.   Would love to see some achievements for the game.
